title: Football news: Chelsea defender Davide Zappacosta ruled out for up to five months
text:
Chelsea defender Davide Zappacosta has been ruled out for up to five months after tearing his anterior cruciate ligament.

The right-back is on loan at Roma and they announced earlier on Friday that he had damaged the ligaments in his right knee before undergoing surgery to have them repaired.

Roma confirmed that the operation on the 27-year-old was successful later in the day.

Chelsea defender Davide Zappacosta has been ruled out for up to five months due to injury

He posted a photo of himself from his hospital bed and vowed to come back stronger

Reports from Sky Sports Italia have suggested he could be out for between four to five months.

He tweeted late on Friday: 'This time the blow was hard, unexpected! I thank Professor Mariani for the intervention, and all those who have been and will be close to me, are my strength!

'I'm ready to work hard and come back stronger than before!'

Zappacosta's season-long loan deal at the Serie A side has a break clause that can be activated by them in January.

The Giallorossi did also confirm that they would be starting his rehabilitation immediately.

Zappacosta has only made one appearance for Roma since making the move towards the end of the summer window.
